objectDesc.p: Typed letter, with handwritten signatures, from E. D. Ballard and J. H. Lewis of the Lincoln Golf and Country Club to Eartha M. White on 11/20/1929, requesting donations of furnishings for the new club house.

editorialDecl.p: This file was transcribed and encoded according to the editorial criteria of the project "Editing the Eartha M.M. White Archive." Using the various options encoded within <choice> elements, this file enables the viewing of a diplomatic transcription and a regularized reading text.

body.p:
As a member of the Lincoln Golf & Country Club and interested
in what we are doing this comes to inform you that we have
completed our club house, electric lightshave been in
stalled, and we are preparing to open the club. But
we have no furnishings for the inside.

We are asking all of our club members and Officers to give
us something to be used in the club house. Anything from
a cup and saucer to a piece of furniture will be of some
service. All of us have labored hard to make this an
ideal spot for recreation and pleasure, and we feel that
you might have something around the home which you can
afford to give for the use of the club.

We are enclosing a slip with a self-addressed envelope.
If you will kindly fill in same and mail to us we will
be very glad to have our representative call and get what
ever you promise. We want to be able to have our open
ing some time in December.

If you have not been out to the club recently we will be
glad to have you come out, as things are looking very
nice there.

closer.salute:
Thanking you in advance for whatever you give, we are,
Very truly yours,
Lincoln Golf & Country Club
closer.signed:
President. E. D. Ballard
Secretary. J. H. Lewis
